collider

Class Collider

  • java.lang.Object
    • collider.Collider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircleCollider, RectCollider

    public abstract class Collider
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for all collider types. Colliders detect when one GameObject intersects/collides with another. For this purpose, a collider must be fitte to the shape of an object. Each GameObject can have several colliders, since complex ahapes need to be approximated by basic shapes like circle, and rectangle. These basic shapes are represented by CircleCollider and RectCollider.
    New colliders can be added representing more complex ways that objects can collide. For this, you subclass Collider and overwrite the method collidesWith(collider.Collider). To ensire consistency, each new collider must be able to handle all old collider classes, but the old ones do not need to be changed. To handle an old collider class X, in collidesWith(collider.Collider) you cast the argument to class X. If this is not possible, you raise an exception. If it is possible, return true or false depending on whether there is a collision. See CircleCollider and RectCollider for exaï¿½ples.
    Author:
    geppe
